title: ANVYA — Representation-Guided Scientific Reasoning Engine
oneLiner: Turns biological prompts into controllable, interpretable 3D molecular visualizations instead of prompt-magic.
problem: Most molecular visualization workflows are powerful but manual; automated ones often hide assumptions. ANVYA aims to make structure generation explicit, controllable, and failure-aware.
built: Designed a dual-mode (scientific/game) 3D visualization engine for molecular structures.
Integrated semantic parsing, predictive assembly, and refinement using PyMOL, SMILES interpreters, and AlphaFold outputs.
Built a context-aware visualization controller and custom domain-specific prompt layer.
results: Reusable pipeline that converts prompts into structured visualization actions.
Clear separation of reasoning, assembly, and rendering for debuggability.

title: Human3D — Context-Aware 3D Reconstruction
oneLiner: End-to-end 2D-to-3D reconstruction with scene context and biomechanical constraints for plausibility.
problem: Pure vision pipelines can produce anatomically implausible humans. Human3D adds constraints and context so reconstructions behave like real bodies.
built: Implemented pipeline using MiDaS (depth), YOLO (keypoints), SAM/CLIP (segmentation).
Built 3D reconstruction using SMPL/SMPL-X and PyTorch3D; used Blender for evaluation.
Developing differentiable constraints: joint limits, bone-length priors, COM stability.
results: Manuscript under submission to CVWW 2026; extended version in preparation for CRV 2026.

title: Undergrad Thesis — Non-Invasive Biomarker ML System
oneLiner: Monte Carlo photon-transport simulation + regression models for haemoglobin and glucose estimation.
problem: Non-invasive physiological estimation suffers from noisy signals and limited labeled data. This project uses physics-based simulation plus ML to predict biomarkers from spectral signals.
built: Generated synthetic optical dataset via Monte Carlo photon-transport simulations.
Built regression models (RF, MLP, SVR) for haemoglobin and glucose prediction.
Designed signal-processing + feature extraction for noisy spectral data; validated on a small experimental dataset.
results: End-to-end pipeline from simulated spectra to biomarker estimates.
Documented validation behavior and robustness limits.

title: Smart India Hackathon — Adaptive Prosthesis Control System
oneLiner: EEG-driven control pipeline with stabilised real-time servo execution for multi-gesture movements.
problem: BCI signals are noisy and unstable, but prosthetic control needs reliable commands. This system focuses on robust preprocessing and stabilised actuation.
built: Designed EEG preprocessing, artifact removal, and gesture classification pipeline.
Implemented real-time servo control for multi-gesture arm movements.
Built a stabilisation layer for noise-suppressed command execution.
results: Demonstrated reliable gesture-to-actuation mapping under noise.
